address.gui.event

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • address.data.AddressBook
      • address.gui.event.Event

  • public class Event
extends AddressBook
    Holds the listeners for everything in the application extends the AddressBook class to use the AddressEntry Vector
    Author:
    Jialiang Zhong

      • DisplayList

        public void DisplayList(java.awt.Button DisplayButton,
                        java.awt.Button RemoveAddress,
                        java.awt.Button AddAddress,
                        java.awt.Button Notes,
                        java.awt.Button FindNote,
                        javax.swing.JScrollPane ScrollPane)
        Used with the Display Button. Loads the JList with AddressBook Vector and displays it on the main GUI's scroll pane. Also enables the remove address and notes button.
        Parameters:
        DisplayButton - Button
        RemoveAddress - Button
        AddAddress - Button
        Notes - Button
        FindNote - Button
        ScrollPane - JScrollPane

      • RemoveEntry

        public void RemoveEntry(java.awt.Button RemoveAddress,
                        javax.swing.JScrollPane ScrollPane)
        Used with the Remove Address button. Removes the address entry from the AddressBook Vector, resets the JList, and refreshed the display. Also connects with the database and removes all the notes associated with this address entry.
        Parameters:
        RemoveAddress - Button
        ScrollPane - ScrollPane

      • Save

        public void Save(java.awt.Button Save)
        The Save/Exit button saves the AddressBook Vector by uploading its contents into the database after it removes all the contents from the database. The application exits after.
        Parameters:
        Save - Button

      • Exit

        public void Exit(java.awt.Button exit)
        The Exit button exits the application without saving.
        Parameters:
        exit - Button

      • Notes

        public void Notes(java.awt.Button Notes,
                  javax.swing.JFrame NotesFrame,
                  javax.swing.JScrollPane NotesScrollPane)
        The Get Notes button opens a window containing the list of notes of on the selected address entry. The listener goes to the database and pulls out notes that corresponds with the ID of the AddressEntry and loads it into the AddressEntry Notes Vector and then the JList display to be shown in the window.
        Parameters:
        Notes - Button
        NotesFrame - JFrame
        NotesScrollPane - JScrollPane

      • AddNote

        public void AddNote(java.awt.Button addNote,
                    javax.swing.JFrame addNoteFrame)
        The New Notes button opens a window to input a new note.
        Parameters:
        addNote - Button
        addNoteFrame - JFrame

      • SubmitNewNote

        public void SubmitNewNote(java.awt.Button submitNewNote,
                          javax.swing.JFrame addNoteFrame,
                          java.awt.TextArea textArea)
        The Submit button for the new notes adds a note into the AddressEntry Notes Vector and the database. It also sets the JList display and refreshes it.
        Parameters:
        submitNewNote - Button
        addNoteFrame - JFrame
        textArea - TextArea

      • RemoveNote

        public void RemoveNote(java.awt.Button RemoveNoteButton)
        The Remove Note button takes the selected note and removes it from the AddressEntry Notes Vector and then searches the database for the note and removes it, as well. The JList is updated with the display.
        Parameters:
        RemoveNoteButton - Button

      • FindNote

        public void FindNote(java.awt.Button findNote,
                     javax.swing.JFrame findNoteFrame)
        The Find Note button opens a window to enter a note to be found.
        Parameters:
        findNote - Button
        findNoteFrame - JFrame

      • SubmitFindNote

        public void SubmitFindNote(java.awt.Button submitFindNote,
                           javax.swing.JFrame addFindFrame,
                           java.awt.TextArea textArea)
        Once the user has entered a note to be found, the Submit button has a listener searches the database that have Note entries with messages that have a match or a partial match with the entered text. The results with unique AddressEntry IDs are saved into a new Vector and then are placed into the JList to be displaced. The "dummy" AddressEntrys are used to preserve the positions of the found AddressEntrys in the JList for selection purposes.
        Parameters:
        submitFindNote - Button
        addFindFrame - JFrame
        textArea - TextArea
